Articles.Content:
Last night, I had the idea of making a Space Station to honor HarvestR. However, I knew eventually I'd lose interest and let it fall to bits. I then thought about doing it with the community, like Serial Space Station. However, only one person can add a module at a time. So, why not do it using DMP?

If you didn't know, DMP (Dark Multi Player) Is a Multiplayer mod for KSP.

So far, there are five modules installed. You can find the HarvestR memorial station on the NoNameShips stock 1.1 server. Its address is www.nonameships.pw Feel free to add to it!

Below is the first module. It has since grown.

Here it is now:

Edited May 31, 2016 by Ultimate Steve

I'd suggest keeping your universe backed up at regular intervals in case two people within physics range of each other and the station do something and it all goes assplodey. I've found DMP's occasional bugginess can be mitigated by just having one player around a station at a time when docking/undocking things.

Also, yay, nice station.

I've got a quicksave.

EDIT: I have, like, five backup saves now. I realize now that the danger might not be with bugs, but with trolls. There's this one guy trying to shoot it with a battle ship.

EDIT EDIT: Thanks for the advice. He ended up blowing it up, but, yay! Yay for backups!

Edited June 1, 2016 by Ultimate Steve

16 hours ago, Ultimate Steve said:

I've got a quicksave.

EDIT: I have, like, five backup saves now. I realize now that the danger might not be with bugs, but with trolls. There's this one guy trying to shoot it with a battle ship.

Then why not make it a large, spherical, fully armed and operational battlestation as only Emperor Kalpetine would approve. Honour HarvesteR with a fireworksdisplay so large, Minmus explodes. Free mints for everyone!
